sections.title: Introduction to React Hooks
sections.description: Learn what hooks are and why they were introduced to React.

content.content: React Hooks were introduced in React 16.8 as a way to use state and other React features in functional components. They allow you to 'hook into' React state and lifecycle features from function components.

content.title: Why Hooks?
content.content: Hooks solve several problems: they make it easier to reuse stateful logic, simplify complex components, and provide a more intuitive API for React concepts.

sections.title: The useState Hook
sections.description: Master the most fundamental hook for managing component state.

content.content: The useState hook is the most commonly used hook. It allows you to add state to functional components.

content.title: Pro Tip
content.content: You can use functional updates when the new state depends on the previous state: setCount(prev => prev + 1)
The useState hook returns an array with two elements: the current state value and a function to update it.
You can use useState with objects and arrays, and even with lazy initialization for expensive computations.

sections.title: The useEffect Hook
sections.description: Handle side effects in your components like data fetching and subscriptions.

content.content: The useEffect hook lets you perform side effects in functional components. It serves the same purpose as componentDidMount, componentDidUpdate, and componentWillUnmount combined.

content.title: Important
content.content: Always include dependencies in the dependency array. Missing dependencies can lead to bugs and stale closures.
Some effects require cleanup to prevent memory leaks, such as subscriptions or timers.

sections.title: Best Practices
sections.description: Learn the do's and don'ts of using React Hooks.

items.text: Only call hooks at the top level
subItems: Don't call hooks inside loops, conditions, or nested functions
This ensures hooks are called in the same order every render

items.text: Only call hooks from React functions
subItems: Call hooks from React functional components

content.title: Common Mistake
content.content: Never call hooks conditionally. This violates the Rules of Hooks and will cause bugs.
